org.openpnp.machine.reference.driver

Class AbstractMotionPlanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openpnp.model.AbstractModelObject
      • org.openpnp.machine.reference.driver.AbstractMotionPlanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Solutions.Subject, MotionPlanner, PropertySheetHolder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullMotionPlanner, ReferenceAdvancedMotionPlanner

    public abstract class AbstractMotionPlanner
extends AbstractModelObject
implements MotionPlanner, PropertySheetHolder
    The AbstractMotionPlanner does all the boring legwork for a typical MotionPlanner and provides the basis for sub-classing in advanced motion planners.
    • The moveTo() calls are recorded as MotionCommands but not yet executed.
    • As soon as some facility needs to wait for a move to actually complete (e.g. Vision), the recorded MotionCommands are transformed into an execution plan of Motions.
    • Any advanced motion planning can take place on the execution plan (Overrides on sub-classes).
    • The execution plan is sent to the drivers.
    • Finally the actual wait for completion takes place.
    • Additional work such as homing(), driver coordination and enumeration, soft-limit checking and rotation angle wrap-around is done.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • setGlobalOffsets

        public void setGlobalOffsets(AxesLocation axesLocation)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MotionPlanner
        Set the current physical or virtual axis positions to be reinterpreted as the specified coordinates. Used after visual homing and to reset a rotation angle after it has wrapped around. In G-Code parlance this is setting a global offset:
        Specified by:
        setGlobalOffsets in interface MotionPlanner
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        http://www.linuxcnc.org/docs/html/gcode/coordinates.html#_the_g92_commands, http://smoothieware.org/g92-cnc, https://github.com/synthetos/TinyG/wiki/Coordinate-Systems#offsets-to-the-offsets-g92

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(HeadMountable hm,
                   AxesLocation axesLocation,
                   double speed,
                   Motion.MotionOption... options)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MotionPlanner
        Add a nominal moveTo() command to the motion sequence. Planner implementations are free to interpolate, reorder, overlap and even slightly change the motion within the constraints of safe OpenPnP machine logic. - Interpolation might include simulated jerk control for constant acceleration controllers etc. - Optimization might alter motion in the Safe Z Zone, like overlapping Nozzle rotations, Z<->XY motion blending, allowing uncoordinated X/Y moves for best acceleration etc.
        Specified by:
        moveTo in interface MotionPlanner
        Parameters:
        hm - The HeadMountable having triggered the move. This is mostly for proprietary machine driver support and might only be a stand-in in some motion blending scenarios.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • interlockMotionAcrossDrivers

        protected void interlockMotionAcrossDrivers(HeadMountable hm,
                                            AxesLocation currentLocation,
                                            AxesLocation newLocation)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        When using multiple drivers with axes, we need to interlock motion commands between drivers, i.e. we need to wait for the completion of the previous motion, before we can start the next motion. For example if we have X and Y on driver 1 and Z on driver 2 we need to make sure Z is up at Safe Z, before we can move X or Y and vice versa. The interlock is avoided, when just one driver moves in multiple segments. For the given example, as long as just X and Y move and Z stays put, there is no need for interlock.
        Parameters:
        hm -
        currentLocation -
        newLocation -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                                                       AxesLocation currentLocation,

        Create the backlash compensated motion according to the settings on the axes. A sub-class might override this method and provide a more advanced implementation, perhaps avoiding some extra moves by motion blending.

        firstAfterCoordination -

      • getMomentaryMotion

        public Motion getMomentaryMotion(double time)
        Description copied from interface: MotionPlanner
        Get the planned motion at a certain time. Works into the future as far as planned and into the past as far as retained. This is used to simulate Camera Views, to analyze excitation by acceleration to predict vibrations etc.
        Specified by:
        getMomentaryMotion in interface MotionPlanner
        Returns:

      • waitForCompletion

        public void waitForCompletion(HeadMountable hm,
                              MotionPlanner.CompletionType completionType)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MotionPlanner
        Perform a coordinated wait for completion. This will force planning and issuing of motion commands to the driver(s) and waiting for completion on all the drivers involved. This must be issued before relying on a specific machine positioning e.g. before capturing camera frames etc.
        Specified by:
        waitForCompletion in interface MotionPlanner
        Parameters:
        hm - The HeadMountable to wait for. If a hm's axes map to only a sub-set of drivers, this will not wait for the other drivers and these are free to move on. If null, wait for all the drivers/machine axes.
        completionType - The kind of completion wanted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • clearMotionPlanOlderThan

        public void clearMotionPlanOlderThan(double time)
        Description copied from interface: MotionPlanner
        Clear the motion planning older than the given real-time from the history of the motion planner. The MotionPlanner is free to do its own house-keeping and get rid of past planning data before this is called.
        Specified by:
        clearMotionPlanOlderThan in interface MotionPlanner
        Parameters:
        time - The start time of the motion to keep. This must be a time returned by waitForCompletion().
